result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Russell Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 4. Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Provide a DNA sample.
*Pay supervision fees.
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.

*Complete batterer's intervention program.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Court advised defendant of appellant rights.

timeConds.notes: *Serve 20 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Russell Turner

records.addlTxt:
DV MEMO, filed. 
**Defendant has absconded, DOC warrant has been issued.  DOC is not requesting condition be imposed, Court takes no further action.  9/6/19 probation review hearing is removed from the calendar.

Defendant Robert Russell Turner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 14 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 20 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Pay supervision fees.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Received and filed: 
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 4.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert Russell Turner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises in trial on another case and no spin courts available. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Robert Russell Turner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 4 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
STATES WITNESS LIST
State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Robert Russell Turner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any 911 or other acts motion must be filed 1 week before the final pretrial. 
Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 2, 2019 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 1, 2019 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defense counsel moves to modify the No Contact Order. Kimberly J addresses the Court. State objects to any modification of the no contact order. Arguments heard. Defense's request to modify the no contact order is DENIED by the Court.

Defendant Robert Russell Turner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. Court grants request. Case remains calendared in Br 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 15, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for LEVEL 3 Supervision.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
KLJ DOB 10/10/73
KYT DOB 12/22/01
KKB DOB 7/8/13
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Russell Turner in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Defendant Robert Russell Turner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 4, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
